result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Lampkin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  AODA and follow through.  DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: STAY 6 months.  Serve with huber for work/school/treatment.

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances and no possession of them except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

AODA and follow through if not already done. 

Assessment, treatment, counsling as deemed appropriate by the Department. 

Payment of any unpaid financial obligations.

VRCW.

In 15CM2050: Ct. 3>>9 months MCJ with 446 days credit. 
In 16CM2534: Ct. 1>>6 months MCJ with 343 days credit. 
In 16CM2535: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ with 343 days credit. 
In 15CM1770: Ct. 2>>90 days MCJ with 446 days credit.

COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP.

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CM2050: Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>SWH for 3 years probation. 
In 15CF955: Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>>SWH for 3 years probation.

In 15CF1152: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>SWH for 5 years probation. 
In 15CM1770: Ct. 2 (DC)>>SWH for 3 years probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation on ALL: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 91 days jail credit on ALL. 
COURT allows def to work off costs with community service if approved by COC Office.
